meanings.definition: Capable of being clearly spoken or pronounced.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's enunciable instructions made it easy for the students to understand.
meanings.sent2: She had an enunciable voice that carried across the room effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to mimic the enunciable words of its owner, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: His enunciable accent stood out in the crowd, like a bright light in a dark room.
meanings.sent5: The enunciable sound of the bell signaled the end of the school day.

meanings.definition: Able to be expressed clearly and distinctly.
meanings.sent1: The enunciable emotions on her face revealed her true feelings.
meanings.sent2: His enunciable writing style made complex ideas easy to comprehend.
meanings.sent3: The enunciable apology from the child melted the hearts of the adults around.
meanings.sent4: The enunciable beauty of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: Her enunciable talent for storytelling captivated the audience.
